line_2: And glad dependants share their patron's joy,

line_1: So shall I gain the gold without alloy;
line_2: So shall I know its use, its pow'r employ,

line_1: Hope in his ills, and to his bliss alloy.
line_2: Lest man should triumph in the present joy;

line_1: Though wine to true pleasure is oft an alloy,
line_2: In the span that's allotted then crowd every joy;

line_1: Theirs is the rural bliss without alloy,
No Strife has ever mingled its alloy,
line_2: No dearer Friendship, and no separate Joy,

line_1: Too blest, indeed, were such without alloy,
line_2: But, foster'd ev'n by Freedom, ills annoy:

line_1: Here Freedom reign'd, without the least Alloy;
line_2: Nor saintly Spleen durst murmur at our Joy,

line_1: Curs'd with such souls of base alloy,
line_2: As can possess, but not enjoy;

line_1: Pain'd without hope, or pleased without alloy;
line_2: For well she knew that neither grief nor joy

line_1: Pleasures unmixt, and leave the base Alloy.
line_2: Earth would be Heav'n, if we might here enjoy

line_1: No; the wild bliss of Nature needs alloy,
line_2: And fear and sorrow fan the fire of joy!
